Posts.Content: Not everyone has chemo, but from my own experience, due to you having what you suggest is quite significant node involvement I'd be suprised if you weren't offered it.
Posts.Title: At last

Posts.Content: That sounds a bit remiss of the onc. Why don't you call up and ask your BCN to find out?
Posts.Title: If you had mastectomy followed by chemo...

Posts.Content: I've been massaging rosemary oil into my scalp for the last couple of weeks. I feel a little surge of excitement when I study my bald patches as I can see significant sprouting. I don't know if it's down to the oil but it's not that expensive, from any good health stores and some chemists and larger boots.
Posts.Title: Hair growing back really patchy

Posts.Content: Hi Anne, unfortunately there is a list of foods to avoid on this site. However, my onc and all the nurses I met during chemo never said anything about avoiding anything. I've heard people, not necessarily on here, say they even avoided going to the cinema etc, in case they picked up a bug. Madness. To be honest, I carried on as normal and did and ate what I liked. I may just have been very lucky but I came out the other side relatively unscathed. I'm not saying ignore the advice, but you could spend hours peeling all your fruit and veg diligently and then pick up a bug while on the bus going for your treatment. I suppose what I'm saying is there is an element of chance in all of this. Being sensible is sensible but you can't avoid every risk.
Posts.Title: Yogurt

Posts.Content: I too agree with others experience. The doctor was quite up front and though he didn't come right out with the c word he said the results of mammogram gave them cause for concern and said the lump looked 'suspicious' so even though the news from path report a week later confirmed it he knew what he was looking at on that fateful day.
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: I've been reading this thread with interest over the last few days and I must say it am so heartened that medics across the board seem to have been so empathic, open and honest with us from the off. Since my diagnosis I have been prone to bouts of paranoia, thinking they may be sugar coating or flim flaming. I think there is a stereotype image of these professionals scrutinising scans and discussing our bits and deciding on what's best for us, and then, when all the info is in, imparting edited version of their wisdom to us poor mortal thickies. I think this may be how it was in the past. I feel so much more confident that I am being told the truth as they see it and that nothing is being hiden from me.
Posts.Title: Do docs play down cancer until they get biopsy results or can they...

Posts.Content: I am several months on from having risk reducing Mx on my right side after having Mx and ANC on the left, last year. I have embarked on having a tattoo. my tattooist has started doing the main design on my good side. Now I am ready to do a bit on the left, but I am a bit apprehensive and wondered if anyone out there has any stories, advice? Any comments welcomed.
Posts.Title: Tattoos

Posts.Content: What a shame you don't get on. You are quite early on if you were only diagnosed three weeks ago. I think where I am the nurses are attached to a particular consultant and team. I found the BCN I was seeing as a bit odd, and didn't feel we gelled. Now I am coming to the end of treatment, reflecting back, I have hardly had any contact with her, apart from the early days. I hardly give her much thought. I love my surgeon and would hate to move to a different consultant to get a different BCN.
Posts.Title: Can I change my Macmillan breast nurse?

Posts.Content: I have a tooth that needs canal treatment. It went dodgy while I was having chemo. Because of a compromised immune system I was told to wait til after chemo. Now it's all done I'm ready for treatment. Based on what I was told by my onc you should be fine as long as you aren't having chemo and your bloods are back to normal. Can you go back to doc and get some reassurance...
Posts.Title: Dentist recommends a root canal filling.

Posts.Content: Oh, sounds a bit complicated. I've not gone down the recon path. Good luck with it all.
Posts.Title: Dentist recommends a root canal filling.

Posts.Content: Thanks Jacky, I do find it helps to know it's not just me. Perverse in a way wanting others to be sharing same. I wish I could feel happy for those who don't have to suffer like us. I don't think it helps to be bitter. I wish I could switch this feeling off.
Posts.Title: Bah humbug

Posts.Content: Sorry, I initially joined to just see what the site was all about. I hadn't felt like posting until today so hadn't really thought about profile. But FYI I have had 3 FEC 3 T and about to start rads. I had MX and ANC in July. I will try to put a profile on.
Posts.Title: Bah humbug

Posts.Content: As it turned out last night wasn't as bad as I'd imagined. I only got one text in the end. People have been texting during the day, which has felt better. However I have felt really anxious all day and was tempted to take one of the lorsapam I have left over from before. So I seem to switch from feeling angry one day to being very scared and anxious the next. Thanks for all the kind advice ect. Gem
Posts.Title: Bah humbug

Posts.Content: Is anyone else feeling angry and resentful towards new year? Initially I was looking forward to Xmas but as it approached I started to get mor unhappy. Getting messages on cards saying things like lets hope next year will be better made me want to tear them up. I joined the site partly to see how others coped with Xmas and have got some comfort from realising I am not alone. am starting to get a bubbling angry feeling just thinking about the new year text frenzy that is almost upon me. I wish I was more positive. I feel like a mean old Scrooge. I would really like to snap out of it. I know it's just a state of mind and in my control, but it's hard.
Posts.Title: Bah humbug

Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne, just to clarify, as I'm not sure from your second post if terminology has been fully understood. My understanding is that a tumor can be benign or malignant. A malignant tumor is a cancerous tumor and vice versa. So, if you have been told your tumor is cancerous it means it is malignant. Sorry if this is labouring the point, but I think it's important you understand what you've been told. Like the others have said it is really important you find out who your BCN. It is a shame she wasn't there when you were given the news, or at least you given her details. This is usually what happens.
Posts.Title: Feel lost

Posts.Content: I only had the injections with the doxetaxel. 5 days after each dousing. I didn't have as severe pains as you described and mainly in my ankles. I did hate the injections though, so feel for you if you have been prescribed at a the start. I was prescribed tramadol, which comes with it's own set of SE, but it is a good pain killer. It's a shame that you weren't warned. From my experience no one escape this... it's not even a true side effect, it's the drug doing what it's supposed to.
Posts.Title: Pain following Neulasta injection

Posts.Content: Nice guidelines say that mild depression should not be be treated with antidepressant medication, in the first instance. It says in moderate to severe depression psychological therapy should be offered as a first line treatment and that antidepressant meds only used if in conjunction with talking therapy. It also says that therapists must be trained professionals in child and adolescent mental health. Has your SD been referred to CAMHS (child and adolescent mental health services). If the GP has identified moderate to severe depression, which from the treatment plan appears to be so, then it seems to my mind this is indicated. I agree, it is a worry. She obviously said enough to the GP for him/her to be quite concerned. If she really is depressed than hopefully this is being addressed appropriately. However, in my own work I have seen many people who have gone on to develop a dependence, not so much the medication, as it's not addictive, but on the whole caring that is elicited in these situations.
Posts.Title: 13 year old given Prozac. Your help.please.

Posts.Content: Unfortunately all of me is bigger.
Posts.Title: Leg Calves Increasing in Size After Chemo!

Posts.Content: Quite often I forget about my breast cancer too. There isn't a particular day for forgetting, but it's usually on waking up of a morning. However, I'm quite lucky because only after a few moments it all comes flooding back.
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: Wow, chloecat, I've been reading looking back at this thread and must say I am quite in awe of your tenacity. I think it's tenaciousness? This is coming from someone who said very loudly CUT IT OUT NOW, and to this date have had everything thrown at it. However, I would be lying if I didn't say I am totally alarmed that you seem more concerned with getting to the bottom of the inconsistency of reports and what you remember people saying months ago, rather than the fact that your tumor is growing. I really do hope that this new news has given you some pause for thought re surgery. In my experience, and for many others too, the detailes of the tumor, including type, grade and size change, sometimes quite dramatically, once it has been cut out and analysed.
Posts.Title: To have the op or try alternative

Posts.Content: I have never been told it's to do with aggressiveness. My understanding is same as Bongo, it's about how responsive to hormone the cancer is/was. So if you are +8 you are a good candidate for hormone therapy.
Posts.Title: ER8. PR8

Posts.Content: My understanding is that if it's a higher number it means hormone treatment will be more effective, so opposite to what you fear.
Posts.Title: ER8. PR8

Posts.Content: Hi AnneH, GillieB has reminded me that I got some strange sensations in my chest while on chemo. They were strange nervy shooting pains round my ribs and between shoulder blades. It took me a while to work out it was indigestion. It did pass. Could this explain the bubble feeling? Maybe you do have a bit of trapped wind.
Posts.Title: Strange sensation

Posts.Content: Breast cancer care uk has a good glossary
Posts.Title: Abbreviations

Posts.Content: I absolutely hated asking for help, and if no offer was forthcoming I preferred to struggle along without. Many people will have a lot of thoughtful things to say. Words are quite easy to come by, don't take a huge amount of effort or time. But a demonstration of thoughtfulness is worth a thousand well meaning empathic phone calls and emails. On the whole, I think the majority of people are pretty rubbish at stepping up. For me, out of all my friends there are only two who really put themselves out for me, and I can live with that. I think it's good to not have very high expectations of others.
Posts.Title: your thoughts please-help should I have to ask or should it be offered...
